title: Thomas McKenzie (footballer)
text:
Thomas McKenzie was a Scottish professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="centre%20forward">centre forward</a> who played in the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish League</a>, <a href="Southern%20Football%20League">Southern League</a> and <a href="Football%20League">Football League</a> in the early 20th century.
Career.
A <a href="centre%20forward">centre forward</a>, McKenzie began his professional career with <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20First%20Division">Scottish League First Division</a> club <a href="Third%20Lanark%20A.C.">Third Lanark</a>. He was a member of the squads which won the league championship in <a href="1903%E2%80%9304%20Scottish%20Division%20One">1903–04</a> and the <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a> in <a href="1905%20Scottish%20Cup%20Final">1904–05</a> and he scored 33 goals in 60 appearances for the club. McKenzie subsequently became a <a href="Journeyman%20%28sports%29">journeyman</a> in English football and played in the <a href="Southern%20Football%20League">Southern</a> and <a href="The%20Football%20League">Football Leagues</a> for <a href="Sunderland%20A.F.C.">Sunderland</a>, <a href="Plymouth%20Argyle%20F.C.">Plymouth Argyle</a>, <a href="Portsmouth%20F.C.">Portsmouth</a>, <a href="Glossop%20A.F.C.">Glossop</a> and <a href="Queens%20Park%20Rangers%20F.C.">Queens Park Rangers</a>.
Honours.
Third Lanark
